Base.Explanation: Manage the email addresses for a mailbox. Email addresses can be added or removed.

Base.Name: Identity
Base.Description: The Identity parameter identifies the mailbox. Use for example the distinguished name (CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com), the domain\account name (tools4ever.com\Jsmith), the alias (JSmith), the User principal name (JSmith@tools4ever.com) or the GUID.

Base.Name: Emailaddress
Base.Description: The Emailaddress parameter specifies the proxy address of the mailbox. It includes the primary Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) address as one of the proxy addresses. For example: smtp:JohnSmith@tools4ever.com". Use a table or text list to specify multiple values.

Base.Name: Remove address
Base.Description: With the 'Remove address' parameter the email address can be removed instead of added to the mailbox.

Base.Name: Domain controller
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the domain controller used to retrieve the data from Active Directory directory service. Use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain controller. For example: EXCHSERVER.tools4ever.com.

Base.Explanation: Setup a session with the Powershell Agent service. The session is requied for a number of UMRA script actions that use the Powershell Agent service. See the online help for more information.

ArrayElement.Name: Session ID
ArrayElement.Description: The identifier of the Powershell Agent service session. The value should be stored in a variable that is used in subsequent UMRA acions thath use the Powershell Agent service session. This property is an 'output only' property. By default, the value for this property is stored in variable %PowershellAgentSessionId%.

Base.Explanation: Setup an Exchange session for PowerShell to manage an Exchange 2010 server.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Connection URI
Base.Description: The Connection URI parameter specifies the location of the PowerShell. For example: 'https://[ExchangeServer].tools4ever.local/Powershell' or 'https://[ExchangeServer]/Powershell' or 'https://ps.outlook.com/powershell/'.

Base.Name: Credential User Name
Base.Description: Optional. The credential user name, use this parameter when you want to access the Exchange Server with an explicit account. The user name must be of an account inside the domain of the Exchange server and must have access to the Exchange server For example: 'tools4ever\JohnSmith'. If not specified, a default security context is tried for the specified authentication method, Generally this will be the security context of the Powershell Agent Service account.

Base.Name: Credential Password
Base.Description: Optional. The encrypted password of the account you want to use to access the Exchange server with. The input should be the encrypted value of the password.

Base.Name: Skip certificate check
Base.Description: With the 'Skip certificate check' parameter you can choose to connect to the exchange server without checking the certificate of the exchange server.

Base.Name: Skip prerequisites test
Base.Description: With the 'Skip prerequisites test' parameter you can choose to skip the check for PowerShell version, windows remoting version, execution policy. Set this only if you're completely sure the check fails, but the settings are correct.

Base.Name: Authentication
Base.Description: Specifies the mechanism that is used to authenticate the user's credentials. Valid values are "Default", "Basic", "Credssp", "Digest", "Kerberos", "Negotiate", and "NegotiateWithImplicitCredential". The default value is "Default".

Base.Name: Advanced: Logging mask
Base.Description: The mask specified here, determines the logging output of ALL the PowerShell actions in this session. Default all messages except debug messages are shown. The mask is build from the following numbers: 1 = Normal, 2 = Error, 4 = Warning, 8 = Info, 128 = Debug. If not specified the number 7 is used.

Base.Explanation: Manage the email addresses for a mailbox. Email addresses can be added or removed.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Name: Domain controller
Base.Description: Optional value. The name of the domain controller used for reading or writing configuration changes. If not specified, Exchange will determine a domain controller. To prevent replication issues always use the same domain controller in the same session. Use the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the domain controller. For example 'EXCHSERVER.tools4ever.com'.

Base.Name: Identity
Base.Description: The identifier of the mailbox. Use for example the distinguished name 'CN=jsmith,OU=sales,DC=tools4ever,DC=com', the Windows Live Id 'jsmith@tools4everlive.com', the domain\account name 'tools4ever.com\Jsmith', the alias 'JSmith', the User principal name 'JSmith@tools4ever.com' or GUID.

Base.Name: E-Mail address
Base.Description: The e-mail address to add or remove. To specify multiple addresses, use the 'E-Mail addresses' parameter. This and the 'E-Mail addresses' parameter can be used simultaneously.

Base.Name: E-Mail addresses
Base.Description: The list of e-mail addresses to add or remove. This parameter can be used simultaneously with the 'E-Mail address' parameter. Specify a text-list value for this parameter.

Base.Name: Remove address(es)
Base.Description: Set to 'Yes' to remove the specified addresses from the mailbox, or set to 'No' to add the specified addresses to the mailbox. If not specified 'No' is assumed.

Base.Explanation: Closes the Exchange session inside the current Powershell session. Use the action Release Powershell Agent service session to subsequently release the Powershell session itself.

Base.Name: Session ID
Base.Description: This parameter identifies the PowerShell Agent service session.

Base.Explanation: Release a session with the Powershell Agent service. The session should be previously setup with action 'Setup Powershell Agent service session'. The session is identified by property 'Session ID'.

ArrayElement.Name: Session ID
ArrayElement.Description: The identifier of the Powershell Agent service session. The value should correspond with property 'Session ID' of action 'Setup Powershell Agent service session', called previously.
